comment: The professor leaves halfway through class and isn't clear about grading criteria. Told me excel was OK to graph with, then took off for it. You can miss 3/30 questions and get a 75, which is questionable. Frontloads all of the info before you start, and even with that, you'll have 80% of the info you need to do it on your own.

Unnecessarily difficult grader; gave everyone Ds or Fs at random, without any clear explanation. No published grading policies. Never used D2L, everything was on paper. Oftentimes ignored written work, and marked the questions as "no work shown". No exams or quizzes. If you take her, always put all your math on a piece of notebook paper every lab!

Professor explained things poorly and when she would critique my groups work she would would give blatantly wrong answers, and her syllabus is from when the course was online for Covid two years ago but never bothered updating it. Professor takes off points for trivial things and would rarely give grades above a 75. Take this prof. if you want a C.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Siddiqui gives you all the formulas before starting the lab which is in a simplified form as compared to the lab manual. She has an accent and can be difficult to understand, but you can ask her and the TA, if available. She maybe strict in grading and takes off points if lab report is written in pencil(she prefers black pen). Drops the lowest.

Terrible Lab professor, on some labs did not give anyone above a 70% on reports for any student, and takes off for minor and trivial errors after confirming in class our data would warrant a good grade. Syllabus she posted was outdated from COVID and over a year old, take this lab if you want a C in a 1 credit hour class. Explains procedures poorly
Very hard to understand, does not give specific directions, picky with the grading, but will always help if u email or go to office hours
Easy lab if you know the information, but I couldn't understand her and she wouldn't explain to me how to do the lab because I had covid 3 weeks before.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: I would say this is one of the easiest physics class. She explains the lab thoroughly and provides all formulas before conducting it (but she is a bit hard to hear). However, she does not use D2L to provide grades or anything. Everything is done via email. But like said before, it's an easy A as the labs are quite easy to do.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: Took her hybrid during covid. She explains the lab and gives you the formulas you will need. She will tell you to talk to the TA if you have questions. She does not answer back to your emails and you don't know your grades until the end of the semester, because she doesn't post anything on D2L. However, its an easy class, show up, do the lab, pass.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: Good professor. I definitely would take again for physics lab.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: Really easy professor to have. She gives all of the equations that you will need for each lab, and she is easy to work with when you are confused on a question. Her accent can be difficult to understand, but for the most part, she is a solid choice. 10/10 would take again. You only have 10 labs to do. No tests/other work/hw.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Attendance taken. Pay attention to the beginning of lab because she explains everything. Do exactly what she wants for the reports and you'll be straight. Got an A on every single lab. Also, I highly recommend using excel for you graphs. No pre lab quizzes or tests or anything.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She is not very clear when she explains the topic before lab. She is nice and is more than willing to help you out if you need it during the experiment. It took me a few weeks to get used to her grading, but after that, I scored 100% on every lab. Be careful on your graphs; she'll take off 10% if they are wrong.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: She has a thick accent but is easy to understated after a while. She walks you through the lab and helps out during the lab if your stuck. As long  as you show your work and answer all the questions she will get a good grade on the lab.

Doesn't understand basic algebra, scientific notation, and takes 40 minutes to explain a lab that takes 10. She marks all of your right answers wrong if you did not follow the exact same steps. I once got into an argument with her over whether or not .0013 was the same as 1.3x10^(-3) as she could not count decimal places, blaming the calculator :(

She is very nice. Make sure you show your work! she thoroughly explains labs before you attempt them. She is not too picky on how you word your answers. Do your calculations she sign off on your lab and you're on your way! TAKE HER CLASS!!!
